column1: Shagrat was an Uruk-hai commanding the garrison of the Tower of Cirith Ungol during the War of the Ring.
During a patrol to Shelobs Lair
column2: Shagrats company encountered a troop of Orcs from Minas Morgul led by Gorbag. The two did not get along
column4: they noted something out of place: a Frodo Baggins
column5: all wound up in Shelobs webs. The discovery of what appeared to be an undersized Elves led the two commanders to compare their notes; they concluded that there must have been another nearby. But they could not find this "great Elf warrior".

column1: Turmoil rose again amongst the group when Gorbag and Shagrat disagreed with what they had to do with the prisoner. Shagrats orders from Sauron were simple; all personal effects were to be sent to Barad-dûr. Shagrat did not trust many of his own troops
column3: so he locked up the prisoner in the top chamber of the Tower of Cirith Ungol.

column1: Gorbag coveted the Mithril shirt Frodo wore
column2: and attempted to usurp Shagrats rule. Though he was larger than his adversary
column3: Gorbag lost to Shagrats superior numbers. Soon
column4: Gorbags faction was pressed back. Shagrat eventually killed Gorbag
column5: and ran off to Sauron with the prisoners belongings. He did not reach Barad-dûr until four days later; Sauron killed him after he delivered the news of intruders.Wayne G. Hammond
